text: I'm not a big fan of Lament of Innocence. It had some good music, and gameplay but it was rather short, and the controls felt a little stiff. Maybe it's just me. SCIV had good music but not the best. For me SOTN has the best and Curse of Darkness the 2nd best. But SCIV would probably be 3rd :D
author: ModifiedDuck

text:
@Smarty4789 

boooO!


Lament of Innocence had best gameplay (soon to be beaten by LOS)
Symphony of the Night had best map/original story
CV-IV forever will have the best music. Come on! Theme of Simon simply beats Bloody Tears on originality, complexity, and epicness...but even CV-IV has the best Bloody Tears out of them all.
author: Michael Groesbeck

text: Now I disagree. SCIV is the better game when it comes to gameplay(whipping in 8 directions is the best thing that ever happened in the series). But when it comes to soundtrack, I'm sorry but you can't compete with Symphony of Night.

text: I agree. The filler started the whole problem for me and it has ruined the experience. But the filler definitely was the reason why I lost interest.
